review: Best Android based TV box I've used.  No need to Jail Break/Root the device.  You can just side-load whatever apps you want.  Very fast Amazon based GUI.  Has all the major internet streaming apps and Plex.  You can easily install Kodi/XBMC.  Good wifi performance.  Love the remote.  Paid $79.00 during the holidays.  I give it 5/5 rating.Update 3/29/15: The power supply for one of my Fire TV's blew today.  Amazon charges $19.99 for a replacement?  I hope this is an anomaly, because the first one didn't even last a year.  There are cheaper alternatives, but it seems that after paying shipping, you are only saving $5.

author: TL15

review: We received this as a Christmas gift and I installed it several days later. After about 10 minutes, when the Fire TV was on, everything else Wi-Fi Would screech to a halt, then the fire TV would constantly say no network connection "try again later. We have FIOS with 75mb up/down, so I determined that was no the issue. I went with a hunch to upgrade the router, and that did the trick. It was an older Verizon router that I imagine did not have the throughput and possibly distance restrictions that the new one does. Now all Wi-Fi devices work fine (Kindle, phones, cams, etc...) while the Amazon Fire TV is active. As far as content, we have not had it long enough to see all the options and what programming it has to offer.
